text: Licentiate of Canon Law (JCL) is the title of a higher graduate degree with canonical effects in the Roman Catholic Church given by pontifical universities of canon law. Licentiate is the title of a person who holds an academic degree called a licence.Canon Law Institutions Must Offer Diploma in Marriage and Procedural Law, Zenit.org, access 25 April 2019. ==References== Category:Academic degrees Category:Catholicism
title: Licentiate of Canon Law
